channel.title: [PI] IP command?
channel.description:
I need to make a command that tells the user their ip, but I can only figure out how to tell the player the servers ip. This is reallyy simple so I feel like a moron for asking, but for some reason I can't figure it out. I know how to make a getip command eg. ::getip [username], but that's to retrieve another users IP address. All I need the command to do is to tell the player their own IP address. (For testing purposes)
Eg: [code] if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("ip"){ String ip = playersIpAddress; //playersIpAddress would be replaced by whatever method you use to retrieve the players ip... c.sendMessage("Your IP Address Is: " + ip; } [/code]
Yes, I've tried Google, for about an hour I researched this but I couldn't find anything that wasn't over-complicated xD Just found a bunch of tutorials that aren't exactly what I need.
Thanks! Sorry if this question seems kind of newbish but I needed some help. :P
Edit:
Okay, now all I need to know is where the connectedFrom method is held. I can't find it. :\

item.title: [PI] IP command?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“belhelmiel, post:3, topic:507225”][quote author=TheLetterQArousesMe link=topic=625455.msg4257296#msg4257296 date=1362974981]
Rep was removed a long time ago
and

or

[/quote]
Wow I missed that one. Didn’t realize they removed it.
And I know about connectedFrom, I tried at that for a while aswell but how would I put that into code? I looked around all over my source for some examples but couldn’t find anything. If you know which class the connectedFrom method held in, I could probably figure the rest out. Thanks. (:[/quote]

Player.class

		public String getConnectedFrom() {
			return connectedFrom;
		}
c.sendMessage("IP: "+c.getConnectedFrom());

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] IP command?
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

I need to make a command that tells the user their ip, but I can only figure out how to tell the player the servers ip.
This is reallyy simple so I feel like a moron for asking, but for some reason I can’t figure it out. I know how to make a getip command eg. ::getip [username], but that’s to retrieve another users IP address.
All I need the command to do is to tell the player their own IP address. (For testing purposes)

Eg:

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("ip"){
    String ip = playersIpAddress; //playersIpAddress would be replaced by whatever method you use to retrieve the players ip...
    c.sendMessage("Your IP Address Is: " + ip;
}

Yes, I’ve tried Google, for about an hour I researched this but I couldn’t find anything that wasn’t over-complicated xD
Just found a bunch of tutorials that aren’t exactly what I need.

Thanks! Sorry if this question seems kind of newbish but I needed some help.

Edit:

Okay, now all I need to know is where the connectedFrom method is held. I can’t find it. :\

Read full topic
